results.title: Approach to sculpture
results.brief_description: The basis of sculptural expression, examples of different forms, and the work of Clement Meadmore. The use of lines, planes and shapes is demonstrated with models and exemplified in the work of modern and classic sculptors. The basic qualities of sculpture. Clement Meadmore working from a model to a full-scale finished sculpture in welded steel.

results.title: Approach to science
results.brief_description: Scientific methods during the war (World War II) were used both to save and destroy life. Science has made the modern world, as is illustrated by the development of electricity, it also maintains the world, for example, by purifying our water supplies. It is also expanding the modern world through such means as wireless waves and radar. This is a look at how science affects the lives of everyday people, and how having a better understanding of science can be helpful to society. No other credits available.

results.title: Approach to science
results.brief_description: This film, made as a tribute to both Sir Ian Clunies Ross and the study of science, illustrates the intangible attitude of the scientist, and shows the place of observation, creative reasoning, assumptions and experimental verification. It also shows the hard grind and disappointments. Suitable for mid-upper Secondary School students. No other credits available.

results.title: Approach
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Salesmanship”.
A training film which stresses the importance of a well planned sales interview. Some of the factors that contribute to a good approach in selling are discussed. Stresses that a sales person must gain the interest, confidence, favourable attention, and positive interest of the prospective customer during the interview.

results.title: Apprenticeship: I wasn't made to be a secretary
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Girls who have chosen to serve apprenticeships in such areas as stonemasonry, automotive mechanics and painting discuss why they decided on these traditionally male dominated stress. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Apples in Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Fred Whatham and Cine Austral Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the development and locations of the apple-growing industry in Tasmania. Illustrates activities related to the planting, culture, harvesting and marketing of apples. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for Upper Primary-Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Apple aphis
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses briefly five of the most destructive of the family Aphididae which attack apple trees and fully illustrates the life-cycle of one of them, the green apple aphis. Using micro-photography techniques the various stages in the life-cycle are shown - from the emergence of the nymph from the egg through to mating and reproduction. A final diagrammatical section summarizes the life-cycle.

results.title: Appearance
results.brief_description: Few of us are happy about the way we look. We are either too short or too fat; our noses are too big or the wrong shape. As more people resort to surgery to alter appearance, this program talks to people about what they’ve done and the effect that it has had on their lives.

results.title: Apollo 11: one giant leap for mankind
results.brief_description: Follows the flight of Apollo 11 to the Moon and back, showing the launching and each stage of the operation with views and comments of the astronauts, their activities on the surface and return trip to President Nixon’s welcome No other credits available
